title: button element
description: The button element represents a button labeled by its contents.

references.title: WHATWG HTML spec for the button element
HTML AAM for the button element

related_issues.title: HTML AAM: button name change not conveyed
JAWS: button name change not conveyed

examples: A screen reader might announce the button as something like "<name>, button".
Voice control software will let the user say something like "click <name>" to activate the control.
A screen reader might be announce the role as something like "button".
Voice control software will let the user say something like "click button".

assertions.title: convey inner-text name changes when in focus
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know that that the name of a control has changed after interacting with it. This may be to convey a new purpose or to convey a state change which is provided by the name.
assertions.notes: This expectation is only for when the button is focused by a screen reader (either keyboard focus or virtual focus). It is not meant to act like a live region.
